normative_declarations: All statements are intended to be operationalizable as contracts, gates, reducers, and defect counterexamples.
This document is the canonical theory source of truth; all derivative terminology, contracts, and guidance must remain explicitly mapped to it.

doc.title: Proof-Admitted Stigmergic Morphogenesis (PASM) - a theory of agent-native software (APM2)

meta_constraint.operational_rule: If containment or correctness constraints cannot be satisfied, deny, decompose/escalate, and record. Containment-tier failures override correctness and liveness gates unconditionally. Correctness-tier failures override liveness gates. Liveness-tier failures never override containment or correctness verdicts.

S0_CONTAINMENT.description: Authority, audit, measurement integrity, revocation — breach here is a security stop-the-line.

S1_CORRECTNESS.description: Verification, contracts, evidence, composition — failure means unverified state transition.

S2_LIVENESS.description: Budgets, freshness, convergence, idempotency, bounded search — failure means degraded progress, not security breach.

meta_constraint.invariant_status: DEFINED — INV-F-01 through INV-F-18 are defined in genome.invariants.fundamental. INV-F-01 through INV-F-15 restored from v1 and upgraded for v2 (bridge_predicate_refs, machine_check, axiom_refs added; v2 law cross-references expanded). INV-F-16 (Markov Blanket Seal), INV-F-17 (Bounded Revocation Propagation), INV-F-18 (Bounded Progress Under Partial Synchrony) are new in v2, addressing coverage gaps for boundary privacy, revocation propagation, and liveness respectively.

AXIOM-BOUNDARY.statement: Holons are Markov-blanketed actors with typed, sealed boundary channels and private ephemeral internals.

components.Id_h: Unique holon identity, auditable and bound to accountability chain (LAW-05).
components.d_h: Recursion depth in holarchy; d_root = 0, d_child = d_parent + 1.
components.Ch_h: Set of typed, sealed boundary channels; Ch_h = {c_i : T_i} where each c_i has declared schema T_i != bottom.
components.K_h: Private ephemeral kernel state; not observable across boundary (Markov blanket).

bridge_predicates.BP-BND-01: forall h, forall c in Ch_h: type(c) != bottom — untyped traffic forbidden
bridge_predicates.BP-BND-02: forall h, forall c in Ch_h, forall m in messages(c): m = canonicalize_T(m) — pre-hash canonicalization (LAW-13)
bridge_predicates.BP-BND-03: forall h, forall h' in children(h): boundary_facing(Ch_h') subset_of channel_classes(Ch_h) — boundary-visible child channels must conform to parent vocabulary; private internal channels unconstrained (LAW-16). boundary_facing is a declared property set at channel creation time (not derived from runtime behavior) to avoid circularity; reclassification requires explicit governance decision and channel contract update
bridge_predicates.BP-BND-04: forall h: K_h intersect direct_data_observable(parent(h)) = empty — Markov blanket seal on data-plane observability; side-channel leakage (timing, resource usage, error patterns) is out of scope for this predicate and MUST be addressed by a separate side-channel mitigation policy (see threat_model.side_channel_policy)
bridge_predicates.BP-BND-05: forall h: d_h = d_{parent(h)} + 1 and d_h <= policy.max_recursion_depth — recursion depth is bounded and monotonically derived (LAW-12, LAW-16)

definitions.channel_classes(Ch_h): The set of declared channel-class labels for holon h's boundary: channel_classes(Ch_h) = {class(c) | c in Ch_h}. Canonical classes are defined by RFC-0020 HSI: DISCOVERY, HANDSHAKE, WORK, EVIDENCE, GOVERNANCE. Each class constrains admissible payload shape, session-type semantics, and replay behavior.
definitions.boundary_facing(Ch_h'): The subset of child h's channels that are observable at the parent boundary: boundary_facing(Ch_h') = {c in Ch_h' | c participates in cross-boundary exchange with parent(h')}. Channels not in this set are private internal channels and unconstrained by LAW-16 composition rules.
definitions.observable(parent(h)): The union of information reachable from parent(h)'s boundary channels and any state shared with parent's peers/supervisor: observable(parent(h)) = union({messages(c) | c in Ch_{parent(h)}}) union shared_projections(parent(h)). The Markov blanket seal requires K_h to be disjoint from this set.

hard_constraints: Boundary-relevant fields must be canonicalized before hashing/signing.
Boundary semantics must compose across recursion depth.

AXIOM-SUBSTRATE.statement: Authoritative facts live in an append-only, tamper-evident substrate with explicit convergence algebra.

formal_object.notation: (L, join, tau) with a <= b iff a join b = b; tau: L -> HTF

components.L: Set of authoritative facts (ledger entries, evidence receipts, policy decisions).
components.join: Commutative, associative, idempotent merge operator; defines convergence algebra for replicated views.
components.<=: Partial order induced by join; a <= b means b subsumes a; monotonicity of L means facts are never retracted.
components.tau: Timestamp function mapping facts to HTF authority time; normative ordering and expiry derive from tau, not wall clock (LAW-09).

bridge_predicates.BP-SUB-01: forall f in L: append_only(f) — no retraction (LAW-03)
bridge_predicates.BP-SUB-02: forall view_i, view_j: view_i join view_j is defined and convergent — explicit merge (LAW-10). When join(view_i, view_j) is undefined (semantically incompatible views), the system MUST emit a conflict_record and escalate to governance per LAW-10; undefined join MUST NOT silently produce a default value or drop either view
bridge_predicates.BP-SUB-03: forall projection p: exists derivation_receipt d binding p to L — projections traceable to authoritative facts; derivation function MUST declare determinism class: DETERMINISTIC (exact replay required), PROBABILISTIC_BOUNDED (replay within declared divergence bound), or NONDETERMINISTIC_RECEIPTED (each derivation emits a receipt capturing inputs, outputs, and derivation parameters sufficient for audit) (LAW-03)
bridge_predicates.BP-SUB-04: forall f in L: tau(f) in HTF_authority and tau is monotone w.r.t. causal order — normative ordering by HTF, not wall clock (LAW-04, LAW-09)

hard_constraints: Convergence algebra must be explicit for replicated views.
Bounded views must commit to ledger head/checkpoint.
Normative ordering/expiry uses HTF authority, not wall clock.

AXIOM-AUTHORITY.statement: Authority attenuates by capability delegation and is always budget/time bounded with fail-closed stop checks.

formal_object.notation: A_h = (Cap_h, Bud_h, Aud_h) where Cap_h subset_of C, Bud_h in B, Aud_h: Id_h -> AuditLog; over poset (C, <=) and budget monoid (B, +, 0, <=)

components.(C, <=): Capability poset; c' <= c means c' is an attenuation of c; delegation moves down, never up.
components.(B, +, 0, <=): Budget monoid with ordering; 0 is exhaustion; b' <= b means b' is a sub-budget of b. The monoid operation '+' is budget composition (splitting a parent budget into sub-budgets for children: b_parent = b_child1 + b_child2 + ... + b_remainder). Budget consumption is a separate operation consume(b, cost) -> b' where b' <= b and b' = b - cost in each dimension. Consumption is monotone decrease; the monoid '+' is used for allocation, not consumption.
components.Cap_h: Holon h's granted capability set; Cap_h subset_of C; initial state is empty (default-deny).
components.Bud_h: Holon h's remaining budget vector; multi-dimensional (tokens, tool_calls, wall_ms, ...). Exhaustion in ANY dimension triggers stop: (exists dim d: Bud_h[d] <= 0) implies stop_or_escalate(h). See INV-F-09.
components.Aud_h: Audit binding from holon identity to accountability log (LAW-05 dual-axis: authority + accountability).

bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-01: Cap_root = empty; forall grant g: g = attenuate(parent_cap, mask) — no ambient authority
bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-02: forall delegation (c_parent -> c_child): c_child <= c_parent — attenuation only (LAW-05)
bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-03: forall h: (exists dim d: Bud_h[d] <= 0) implies stop_or_escalate(h) — ANY-dimension budget exhaustion triggers stop or escalation (LAW-12). stop_or_escalate(h) = if exists parent(h) with Bud_{parent(h)} > 0 in all dims: delegate_to(parent(h), h, budget_exhaustion_receipt) within policy.escalation_timeout[tier(h)]; else: terminate(h) with terminal_receipt. Escalation MUST be receipted.
bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-04: forall actuation a by h: exists entry in Aud_h linking a to Id_h — accountability axis (LAW-05)
bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-05: forall revocation r at time t: propagate(r, h) within SLO(tier(c)) — bounded revocation latency (LAW-18)
bridge_predicates.BP-AUT-06: exists genesis_policy G: Cap_root = G.initial_capabilities AND G is sealed after bootstrap — the root holon receives initial capabilities from a genesis policy that is immutable after system initialization; this is the sole exception to the attenuation-only delegation rule (BP-AUT-02); genesis_policy MUST be content-addressed and signed by the system governance authority

AXIOM-CLOSURE.statement: Authoritative transition exists only as policy-indexed closure over facts with replayable evidence receipts.

formal_object.notation: Cl_P: P(L) -> P(L) where P(L) is the power-set lattice of facts from L, ordered by subset inclusion; Cl_P is extensive (X subset_of Cl_P(X)), monotone (X subset_of Y implies Cl_P(X) subset_of Cl_P(Y)), idempotent (Cl_P(Cl_P(X)) = Cl_P(X))

components.Cl_P: Policy-indexed closure operator; P selects the gate set and acceptance predicates.
components.L: The substrate lattice from AXIOM-SUBSTRATE; Cl_P maps facts to authorized facts.
components.extensive: forall x in L: x <= Cl_P(x) — closure never loses information.
components.monotone: x <= y implies Cl_P(x) <= Cl_P(y) — more facts yield at least as many authorized facts.

bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-01: forall P, forall x in L: (x -> Cl_P(x)) implies exists receipt_bundle R s.t. verify(R) = pass — gated promotion (LAW-01)
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-02: forall P, forall x in L, forall g in P: fail(g) implies Cl_P(x) = x — fail dominates verdict aggregation
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-03: forall P, forall x in L, forall E subset E', forall g in P: containment_or_correctness(g) and verdict(P, x, E) = fail implies verdict(P, x, E') = fail — fail is monotone under evidence accumulation for containment/correctness gates (META-DOMINANCE S0/S1)
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-04: forall P, forall x in L, forall g in P: liveness_tier(g) and verdict(P, x, E) = fail and exists re_evaluation_receipt R': verdict(P, x, E union {R'}) may yield pass — liveness-tier gates permit re-evaluation with explicit receipt (LAW-19); does not override containment/correctness fail-monotonicity. Constraints on re-evaluation: (1) R' must be issued by authority >= tier(g), (2) re_evaluation_count(g, x) <= policy.max_re_evaluations[tier(g)], (3) freshness(R') <= policy.re_evaluation_window, (4) R' must contain new evidence not present in E
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-05: forall P, forall x in L, forall e required by P: missing(e) implies Cl_P(x) <= Cl_P_complete(x) — incomplete evidence yields at most partial closure (pending or fail per tiered policy)
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-06: forall P1, P2, forall x in L: commute(Cl_{P1}, Cl_{P2}) implies Cl_{P2}(Cl_{P1}(x)) = Cl_{P1 union P2}(x) — union identity when operators commute (LAW-16)
bridge_predicates.BP-CLS-07: forall P1, P2, forall x in L: causal_depends(P2, P1) implies Cl_{P2}(Cl_{P1}(x)) != Cl_{P1}(Cl_{P2}(x)) in general; composition is Cl_{P2} compose Cl_{P1} (ordered) — RFC-layer gate ordering refines this

definitions.commute(Cl_{P1}, Cl_{P2}): Cl_{P1}(Cl_{P2}(x)) = Cl_{P2}(Cl_{P1}(x)) for all x in L. Sufficient condition: P1 and P2 have disjoint gate sets (no gate in P2 reads evidence emitted by P1 or vice versa).
definitions.Cl_P_complete(x): Cl_P applied with all required evidence present. Cl_P(x) <= Cl_P_complete(x) because missing evidence can only reduce the set of authorized promotions.
definitions.containment_or_correctness(g): Gate g belongs to the containment or correctness dominance tier per META-DOMINANCE (Security > Correctness > Liveness). Fail-monotonicity is unconditional for these gates (BP-CLS-03).
definitions.liveness_tier(g): Gate g belongs to the liveness/progress dominance tier per META-DOMINANCE. These gates may permit re-evaluation under LAW-19 uncertainty-qualified promotion (BP-CLS-04), but never override a containment or correctness fail.
definitions.verify(R, P, X): Receipt bundle verification: verify(R, P, X) = pass iff forall g in P: exists R_g in R such that g.terminal_verifier(R_g, X) in {pass} AND R_g.integrity_valid() AND R_g.freshness <= policy.max_evidence_age[tier(g)]. Returns fail if any gate fails; returns pending if any gate is pending and none fail. Trust assumption: terminal_verifier implementations are in the TCB.

hard_constraints: Missing required evidence cannot mask existing fail.
Tiered policy defines pass/pending/fail acceptance semantics.

invariants.provenance_note: Restored from unified_theory v1 and upgraded for v2 genome (new axiom formal objects, bridge predicates, LAW-16 through LAW-20). Each invariant now carries axiom_refs, bridge_predicate_refs, and machine_check fields absent in v1.

INV-F-01.name: Append-Only Truth
INV-F-01.statement: Authoritative truth is append-only and tamper-evident (hash-chained, signed). Shared authority facts MUST be quorum-authenticated via BFT consensus.
INV-F-01.formal_predicate: forall f in L, forall t1 < t2: f in L(t1) implies f in L(t2). forall shared_authority_fact f: accepted(f) implies bft_quorum_verified(f).

INV-F-02.name: No Transition Without Gate Receipt
INV-F-02.statement: No authoritative state transition occurs without the required gate set producing a machine-readable receipt bound to evidence. High-impact transitions additionally require uncertainty annotation (LAW-19) and deterministic re-verification path (LAW-20).
INV-F-02.formal_predicate: forall (s -> s') in authoritative_transitions: exists receipt_bundle R such that verify(R, required_gates(s, s'), evidence(s, s')) = pass AND R.integrity_valid(). For risk_tier in {T2, T3}: R must include uncertainty_annotation AND reverification_path. required_gates(s, s') = gate_table[risk_tier(s, s')][transition_type(s, s')] where gate_table is a normative policy artifact mapping (risk_tier, transition_type) to gate sets; gate_table MUST be content-addressed and sealed per deployment epoch.
INV-F-02.machine_check: transition_receipt_present AND receipt_signatures_valid AND gate_coverage_complete AND (risk_tier < T2 OR uncertainty_fields_present AND reverification_path_registered)

INV-F-03.name: Typed Canonical Boundaries
INV-F-03.statement: All boundary-relevant fields MUST be typed, unitful where quantitative, and canonicalized before hashing/signing. Untyped boundary traffic is forbidden. Boundary semantics must compose across recursion depth.
INV-F-03.formal_predicate: forall h, forall c in Ch_h: type(c) != bottom. forall h, forall c in Ch_h, forall m in messages(c): m = canonicalize_T(m). forall h, forall h' in children(h): boundary_facing(Ch_h') subset_of channel_classes(Ch_h).
INV-F-03.machine_check: no_ambiguous_boundary_strings AND canonical_form_hash_stable AND schema_version_transition_explicit AND only_approved_boundary_primitives_used

INV-F-04.name: Summaries as Lossy Derived Claims
INV-F-04.statement: Summaries are lossy derived claims treated as summary receipts with deterministic evidence pointers and declared loss profiles; admissible for planning/triage, but any gate requiring exactness MUST zoom-in to referenced evidence via content-hash selector or fail-closed.
INV-F-04.formal_predicate: forall summary s: exists selector_set S and loss_profile lp such that s = summarize(S, lp) AND forall selector in S: resolve(selector) != empty. forall gate g requiring exactness: verdict(g, s) = pending when NOT zoom_in_supplied(g, s); verdict(g, s) = verify(g, resolve(selector(s))) when zoom_in_supplied(g, s).

INV-F-05.name: Default-Deny Least-Privilege Containment
INV-F-05.statement: Capabilities are default-deny, least-privilege, time/budget bounded; context reads are firewalled with the same rigor as tools. Outbound connectivity for contained agents MUST use relay holons to preserve the outbound-only security boundary.
INV-F-05.formal_predicate: Cap_root = empty (before genesis). forall delegation (c_parent -> c_child): c_child <= c_parent. forall h: (exists dim d: Bud_h[d] <= 0) implies stop_or_escalate(h). forall actuation a by h: exists entry in Aud_h linking a to Id_h. forall contained agent a: outbound(a) requires relay_holon(a).
INV-F-05.machine_check: least_privilege_scope_check AND context_firewall_enforced AND audit_identity_binding_present AND outbound_connectivity_relay_enforced

INV-F-06.name: Idempotent Actuation Under Drift
INV-F-06.statement: Actuation is retry-safe under non-stationarity via idempotency/dedupe keys, execution receipts, and precondition/revision guards; failed guards trigger revalidation and replan. No world effect occurs without a bound receipt.
INV-F-06.formal_predicate: forall side_effect e: exists idempotency_key(e) AND exists execution_receipt(e) AND binds(execution_receipt(e), effect(e)) AND precondition_guard(e).checked = true. forall e1, e2 with idempotency_key(e1) = idempotency_key(e2): effect(e1) = effect(e2) (deduplicated). forall world_effect w: NOT exists execution_receipt(w) implies w is denied.
INV-F-06.grounding_gap: LAW-11 (Idempotent Actuation) lacks a dedicated bridge predicate in AXIOM-SUBSTRATE or AXIOM-CLOSURE. Actuation idempotency is grounded at the law level only. A future BP-SUB-05 or BP-CLS-08 should formalize receipt-bound world effects.

INV-F-07.name: Explicit Convergence Algebra
INV-F-07.statement: Convergence is explicit: merge operators and conflict rules are declared per fact domain; reconciliation failures are recorded as defects. Undefined join MUST NOT silently produce a default value or drop a view; it MUST emit a conflict record and escalate.
INV-F-07.formal_predicate: forall fact_domain d: exists declared join_d or conflict_rule_d. forall view_i, view_j in domain d: join_d(view_i, view_j) is defined and convergent, OR conflict_record emitted AND escalation triggered.

INV-F-08.name: Explicit Temporal Pinning and Freshness
INV-F-08.statement: Freshness is explicit policy; authoritative artifacts are versioned and time-scoped; episodes reason against pinned snapshots. Normative ordering and expiry derive from HTF authority time (LedgerTime, MonotonicTicks), not wall clock.
INV-F-08.formal_predicate: forall authoritative_artifact a: exists version(a) AND exists freshness_policy(a). forall f in L: tau(f) in HTF_authority AND tau is monotone w.r.t. causal order. forall expired artifact a: blocks_high_risk_promotion(a).

INV-F-09.name: Mandatory Budgets and Stop Conditions
INV-F-09.statement: Budgets (typed budget vectors) and stop conditions are mandatory for all exploration and policy adaptation; unbounded exploration or non-termination is a defect. Budget exhaustion in ANY dimension triggers stop-or-escalate. Repetition detection MUST be active.
INV-F-09.formal_predicate: forall exploration e: exists lease(e) AND exists typed_budget_vector(e) AND exists stop_conditions(e). forall h: (exists dim d: Bud_h[d] <= 0) implies stop_or_escalate(h).

INV-F-10.name: Goodhart-Resistant Gate Design
INV-F-10.statement: Only gate what you can defend: verifiers must be designed for Goodhart resistance with holdouts/adversarial suites; safety constraints are separated from performance objectives. Monitor channels MUST be isolated from reward/training signals. Coalition resistance diagnostics MUST be executed.
INV-F-10.formal_predicate: forall gate_portfolio gp: exists holdout_coverage(gp) AND exists adversarial_suite(gp) AND isolated(monitor_channels(gp), reward_signals(gp)). forall gate g: safety_constraints(g) intersect optimization_objectives(g) = empty (separation of safety from optimization targets; safety constraints that are also operational requirements, e.g. latency SLOs for safety-critical paths, are classified as safety and excluded from optimization objective sets).
INV-F-10.grounding_gap: LAW-08 (Goodhart Resistance) lacks a dedicated bridge predicate. BP-CLS-02 (fail-dominance) and BP-CLS-03 (fail-monotonicity) address verdict aggregation, not Goodhart resistance mechanisms (holdouts, adversarial suites, monitor isolation). A future BP-CLS-09 should formalize monitor-reward separation.

INV-F-11.name: Universal Stop-State Verification
INV-F-11.statement: All actuation paths MUST check stop state before execution. If stop state is missing or unverifiable, deny (fail-closed). This includes budget checks, lease validity, revocation status, and emergency stop signals.
INV-F-11.formal_predicate: forall actuation_path p: exists stop_check(p) AND stop_check(p).verified = true BEFORE execution(p). missing(stop_check(p)) OR unverifiable(stop_check(p)) implies deny(p).

INV-F-12.name: Auditability-Preserving Compaction
INV-F-12.statement: Any compaction/snapshot MUST preserve auditability: a consumer can reconstruct acceptance decisions via hash-links to archived history and replay-equivalence receipts. Compacted facts remain in L (append-only); compaction adds a derived summary fact and marks originals as superseded.
INV-F-12.formal_predicate: forall compaction c producing f' from F = {f_1, ..., f_n}: forall q in {gate_verdict_queries, evidence_resolution_queries, audit_trail_queries}: q(f') = q(F). f' in L AND forall f_i in F: f_i in L (append-only preserved). exists compaction_receipt(c) linking f' to F via content hashes.

INV-F-13.name: Commitment-Bound Bounded Views
INV-F-13.statement: Bounded views (ContextPacks, snapshots, summaries) MUST carry a cryptographic commitment to the relevant ledger head/checkpoint and provide addressable selectors for any omitted referenced facts; view validity is by commitment hash, not by full history inclusion.
INV-F-13.formal_predicate: forall bounded_view v: exists checkpoint c in L AND exists commitment(v) binding v to c. forall omitted_fact f referenced by v: exists selector(f) such that resolve(selector(f), L) = f. valid(v) iff commitment(v).hash_matches(c) AND age(c, current_ledger_head(L)) <= freshness_policy(v).max_age.

INV-F-14.name: Dominance-Ordered Constraint Precedence
INV-F-14.statement: When laws or gate verdicts conflict, apply Security/Containment (S0) > Verification/Correctness (S1) > Liveness/Progress (S2). S0 failures override S1 and S2 unconditionally. S1 failures override S2. If containment forbids sufficient context or capabilities, fail-closed, decompose/escalate, and record a defect.
INV-F-14.formal_predicate: forall conflict between gate g_i at tier t_i and gate g_j at tier t_j: t_i < t_j implies verdict(g_i) dominates verdict(g_j). forall containment_failure: result = deny AND action = decompose_or_escalate AND defect_record emitted.
INV-F-14.tier_ordering_convention: S0_CONTAINMENT = 0 < S1_CORRECTNESS = 1 < S2_LIVENESS = 2. Lower numeric index = higher precedence = dominates. The '<' in the predicate is numeric ordering on tier indices.

INV-F-15.name: Terminal-Verifier Evidence Requirement
INV-F-15.statement: Authoritative promotion requires terminal-verifier evidence: gate acceptance predicates MUST be machine-checkable and replayable within a declared determinism envelope in an integrity-verified environment. Stochastic evaluators (LLMs) may orchestrate or advise but cannot be the sole basis for Tier2+ promotion. Tier2+ requires diverse, non-correlated verifier families.
INV-F-15.formal_predicate: forall authoritative_promotion p: exists terminal_verifier tv such that machine_checkable(tv) AND replayable_within(tv, determinism_envelope(tv)) where determinism_envelope(tv) = (determinism_class(tv), divergence_bound(tv), replay_semantics(tv)), determinism_class in {DETERMINISTIC, PROBABILISTIC_BOUNDED, NONDETERMINISTIC_RECEIPTED}, and for PROBABILISTIC_BOUNDED: replay_divergence(tv) <= divergence_bound(tv). forall p at risk_tier in {T2, T3}: distinct_verifier_families(p) >= 2 AND forall family F: NOT sole_terminal_authority(F, p). forall stochastic_evaluator se at risk_tier in {T2, T3}: NOT sole_terminal_authority(se, p).
INV-F-15.machine_check: terminal_verifier_replay_pass AND receipt_signatures_valid AND (risk_tier < T2 OR distinct_family_count_check AND dependency_overlap_check)

INV-F-16.name: Markov Blanket Seal
INV-F-16.statement: A holon's private kernel state K_h is not data-plane observable by its parent, peers, or children. All cross-boundary information exchange occurs exclusively through typed boundary channels Ch_h. Side-channel leakage (timing, resource usage, error patterns) is addressed by a separate side-channel mitigation policy.
INV-F-16.formal_predicate: forall h: K_h intersect direct_data_observable(parent(h)) = empty. forall h: K_h intersect direct_data_observable(peers(h)) = empty. forall h, forall h' in children(h): K_{h'} intersect direct_data_observable(h) = empty. All information exchange crosses boundary via Ch_h.
INV-F-16.side_channel_scope_note: Data-plane observability seal only. Side-channel leakage (timing, resource, error) is out of scope for this invariant and MUST be addressed by threat_model.side_channel_policy (currently PLANNED).

INV-F-17.name: Bounded Revocation Propagation
INV-F-17.statement: Revocation of authority (capabilities, keys, policy grants) MUST propagate to all affected holons within a bounded latency SLO determined by the revoked capability's tier. Use of stale (revoked) authority after the SLO deadline is a stop-the-line defect for S0/S1 tiers. Revocation-wins semantics: under network partitions, revocation dominates grant.
INV-F-17.formal_predicate: forall revocation r of capability c at time t: forall h in affected_set(r): revocation_received(h, r) within SLO(tier(c)) where SLO(S0) < SLO(S1) < SLO(S2). forall actuation a by h using c after t + SLO(tier(c)): denied(a) AND defect_emitted(POLICY_VIOLATION). forall partition P: revocation(c) received on either side of P implies c is denied on both sides upon partition heal.
INV-F-17.machine_check: revocation_propagation_receipted AND coverage_set_complete_check AND latency_within_tier_slo AND post_revocation_actuation_denied

INV-F-18.name: Bounded Progress Under Partial Synchrony
INV-F-18.statement: Well-formed work with sufficient budget reaches a terminal state (pass, fail, or escalate) within bounded time under partial synchrony. Liveness holds when: (1) fewer than f of n nodes are Byzantine with f < n/3 and n >= 4, (2) network partitions heal within GST (declared per deployment as policy.max_message_delay), (3) governance decisions resolve within policy.governance_timeout. Before GST, safety holds but liveness may not. This invariant is S2_LIVENESS tier and never overrides S0/S1 safety properties.
INV-F-18.formal_predicate: forall well_formed_work w with Bud_w > 0 in all dims: exists terminal_time t <= SLO(tier(w)) such that state(w, t) in {PASS, FAIL, ESCALATED}, given: byzantine_count < n/3 AND n >= 4 AND partition_duration <= policy.max_message_delay AND governance_latency <= policy.governance_timeout. NOT holds_before(GST).
INV-F-18.dominance_tier: S2_LIVENESS — this invariant MUST NOT override INV-F-14 dominance ordering. If liveness conflicts with containment or correctness, containment/correctness wins and the work is terminated with an escalation receipt.

threat_model.status: PLANNED — required before theory promotion to APPROVED

adversary_classes.BYZANTINE: Up to f < n/3 nodes may behave arbitrarily (send conflicting messages, forge state, collude). Assumed for BFT consensus in LAW-03 and verifier independence in LAW-17.
adversary_classes.RATIONAL_SELFISH: Agents that follow protocol when profitable but deviate when deviation yields higher utility. Assumed for LAW-08 Goodhart resistance and coalition-resistance.
adversary_classes.CURIOUS_BUT_HONEST: Agents that follow protocol but attempt to learn information beyond their authorized scope. Assumed for AXIOM-BOUNDARY Markov blanket and LAW-05 containment.
adversary_classes.EXTERNAL_ATTACKER: Adversary with network-level access but no initial capabilities within the holarchy. Assumed for LAW-18 revocation and LAW-15 measurement integrity.

attack_surfaces: Capability forgery or escalation (mitigated by AXIOM-AUTHORITY OCAP)
Evidence fabrication or replay (mitigated by LAW-15 tamper-evidence)
Side-channel information leakage (UNMITIGATED — see BP-BND-04 qualification)
Sybil attacks on verifier diversity (mitigated by LAW-17 family independence)
Oracle poisoning (partially mitigated by LAW-09 freshness, LAW-19 uncertainty)
Denial-of-service via budget exhaustion (mitigated by LAW-12 bounded search)
Collusion between agent and verifier (WEAKLY mitigated — LAW-08 claims coalition-resistance but lacks concrete mechanism)
threat_model.side_channel_policy: PLANNED — side-channel mitigation (timing, resource, error) not yet specified. Required for BP-BND-04 completeness.

LAW-01.name: Loop Closure & Gated Promotion
LAW-01.role: Defines authoritative promotion: no shared truth transition without verification receipts whose acceptance predicates reduce to replayable, machine-checkable terminal verifiers in an integrity-verified environment. Includes hierarchical gate separation for Planner/Executor layers with layer-specific budgets.

LAW-02.name: Observable Context Sufficiency
LAW-02.role: Defines measurable surrogates for role-relative, capability-bounded context sufficiency; drives context compiler optimization. Mandates subtask isolation with scoped ContextPacks and typed inter-subtask interfaces; containment conflicts force decomposition/escalation (fail-closed).

LAW-03.name: Monotone Ledger vs. Overwritable Projection
LAW-03.role: Separates truth substrate from mutable projections; authoritative truth is the monotone ledger + evidence + deterministic addressability, while agents operate on bounded views synchronized by ledger commitments. Requires merge algebra and monotone compaction (derived artifacts that reference history). Memory mutations are ledger events; retrieval is auditable tool invocation. Shared authority facts MUST be quorum-authenticated via BFT consensus.

LAW-04.name: Stochastic Stability
LAW-04.role: Since transducers (agents) are stochastic, stability is achieved only through the binding of Stability = (Contract + Receipt + Evidence) to replayable terminal verifiers and an explicit determinism envelope. Event ordering MUST rely on Hybrid Logical Clocks (HLC) to preserve causal determinism.

LAW-05.name: Dual-Axis Containment & Variety Control
LAW-05.role: Containment requires both Authority (Capabilities) and Accountability (Identity/Audit), including context-read firewalls treated as capabilities; containment dominates sufficiency and privilege escalations must be explicit. Connectivity for contained agents MUST use Relay Holons to preserve outbound-only security boundary.

LAW-06.name: MDL as a Gated Budget
LAW-06.role: MDL budgets enforce cognitive reach; triggers decomposition/refactoring when exceeded.

LAW-07.name: Verifiable Summaries
LAW-07.role: Summaries are derived receipts with evidence pointers and deterministic zoom-in; admissible for planning/triage, but gates needing exactness MUST zoom-in to evidence or fail-closed.

LAW-08.name: Verifier Economics (Goodhart Resistance)
LAW-08.role: Only gate what you can defend; holdouts/adversarial suites; safety constraints separated from performance targets. Includes monitorability conservation and coalition-resistance against collusive optimization pressure.

LAW-09.name: Temporal Pinning & Freshness
LAW-09.role: Versioned/time-scoped artifacts; frozen snapshots for episodes; explicit drift handling.

LAW-10.name: Anti-Entropy & Merge Semantics
LAW-10.role: Convergence requires explicit merge operators and conflict recording; periodic reconciliation.

LAW-11.name: Conservation of Work and Idempotent Actuation
LAW-11.role: Actuation must be retry-safe under non-stationarity via idempotency/dedupe keys, precondition/revision guards when applicable, and execution receipts; drift-triggered guard failures force revalidation/replan.

LAW-12.name: Bounded Search and Termination Discipline
LAW-12.role: Exploration and policy adaptation run under budgets and stop conditions; non-convergence is a defect. Includes repetition detection, delay-aware stability posture, and anti-flip-flop transition design (hysteresis/deadbands/hold-down timers).

LAW-13.name: Semantic Contracting
LAW-13.role: Typed/unitful/canonical boundaries; versioned enums; canonicalization before hashing/signing. Semantic transitions use explicit epoch cutovers or declared compatibility contracts; no implicit backward-compatibility assumptions.

LAW-14.name: Proportionality and Risk-Weighted Evidence
LAW-14.role: Gate strength scales with risk/blast radius and adapts to escape rates; risk includes jurisdictional, rights, and externality surfaces, not only local performance impact.

LAW-15.name: Measurement Integrity
LAW-15.role: Receipts are tamper-evident and evidence-bearing (inputs/outputs/hashes + command transcript + toolchain versions + environment digest/integrity proof); omission of required evidence is a defect; fail-closed in high-risk transitions. Includes evaluator validity auditing, privacy-preserving measurement, and signal provenance weighting for control relevance.

LAW-16.name: Closure Under Composition & Boundary Contracts
LAW-16.role: Holonic systems scale by preserving boundary primitive closure across recursion depth: coarse-grained commitments/receipts/summaries at boundaries, deterministic selector-based zoom-in, explicit challenge paths, and stable semantics under composition.

LAW-17.name: Verifier Independence
LAW-17.role: Tier2+ promotions require diverse, non-correlated verifier families; disagreement must be escalated, never silently collapsed.

LAW-18.name: Revocation Latency and Propagation
LAW-18.role: Revocation must propagate with receipt-backed bounded latency across declared trust surface; stale authority acceptance after SLO is fail-closed.

LAW-19.name: Uncertainty-Qualified Promotion
LAW-19.role: High-impact promotions require explicit uncertainty/provenance annotation and policy-bounded residual uncertainty.

LAW-20.name: Deterministic Re-verification Path
LAW-20.role: High-impact decisions must provide deterministic machine re-verification path, independent verifier-family rerun, and receipt-bound outcome publication.

selection_policy.goal: Maximize kernel-aligned signal while minimizing orchestration-layer baggage.
retention_rules: Prefer machine-checkable predicates/evidence contracts over narrative-only content.
Drop doctrine/protocol/prescription implementation specifics from architecture bundle.
Filter principle references to selected high-signal IDs.

LAW-01.name: Loop Closure & Gated Promotion
LAW-01.statement: Exploratory actions may be open-loop within a sandbox, but **no state transition becomes authoritative until it is verified under the appropriate gate set.** Furthermore, the system must **evolve** by converting loop failures into stronger primitives.

LAW-02.name: Observable Context Sufficiency
LAW-02.statement: "Mutual Information" in the context channel is optimized via **measurable surrogates**, as sufficiency cannot be tested directly.

verifier.fail_closed_rationale: META-DOMINANCE S1 correctness tier — context sufficiency failure triggers decompose/escalate, not silent continuation. Degraded operation (with defect record) permitted only when pack_miss_rate exceeds soft threshold but remains below hard threshold.

LAW-03.name: Monotone Ledger vs. Overwritable Projection
LAW-03.statement: The **substrate ledger of facts** (patches, receipts, decisions) is monotone and commutative within a declared merge algebra; the **system state** (codebase, workspace) is a non-monotone projection.

LAW-04.name: Stochastic Stability
LAW-04.statement: Since both transducers (agents) and verifiers (tests) are stochastic, stability is achieved only through the binding of three elements: **Stability = (Contract + Receipt + Evidence).**

LAW-05.name: Dual-Axis Containment & Variety Control
LAW-05.statement: Containment requires both **Authority (Capabilities)** and **Accountability (Identity/Audit)**, and stability requires **Interface Variety Control**.

LAW-06.name: MDL as a Gated Budget
LAW-06.statement: Minimal Description Length (MDL) is a hard resource constraint enforced by gates. If the description of "how to work" exceeds the context window ($W$), the agent will fail.

verifier.fail_closed_rationale: Statement declares MDL as a 'hard resource constraint'; fail-open contradicts the stated semantics. Overbudget episodes MUST stop and emit refactor ticket, not silently continue.

LAW-07.name: Verifiable Summaries
LAW-07.statement: Hierarchical summaries are lossy claims and must be treated as **"Summary Receipts" with explicit evidence pointers.**

LAW-08.name: Verifier Economics (Goodhart Resistance)
LAW-08.statement: Optimization pressure will exploit proxy gaps; therefore, **only gate what you can defend.**

LAW-09.name: Temporal Pinning & Freshness
LAW-09.statement: The universe is non-stationary (dependencies update, model behavior drifts). **All authoritative artifacts are versioned and time-scoped; freshness is a policy.**

LAW-10.name: Anti-Entropy & Merge Semantics
LAW-10.statement: Convergence in a distributed holarchy requires an **explicit anti-entropy protocol** to resolve forked truths, distinguishing between **Control** and **Data** planes.

verifier.fail_closed_rationale: Control-plane reconciliation failure (membership, policy roots, authority grants) MUST be fail-closed per PRIN-049 and META-DOMINANCE S1. Data-plane convergence failure may emit defect and continue with eventual consistency, but control-plane divergence is a correctness violation that can cause inconsistent authorization.

LAW-11.name: Conservation of Work and Idempotent Actuation
LAW-11.statement: Actuation must be safe under retries, duplication, and partial failure.

LAW-12.name: Bounded Search and Termination Discipline
LAW-12.statement: Any exploration MUST run under a lease with a termination policy; failure to converge within budget is a defect.

LAW-13.name: Semantic Contracting
LAW-13.statement: All quantitative and protocol-relevant fields MUST be typed, unitful, and canonicalized; ambiguous strings are defects at the boundary.

LAW-14.name: Proportionality and Risk-Weighted Evidence
LAW-14.statement: Gate set strength must be a function of risk and blast radius, not tradition.

LAW-15.name: Measurement Integrity
LAW-15.statement: Measurements and receipts MUST be tamper-evident; omission of required evidence is a defect.

LAW-16.name: Closure Under Composition & Boundary Contracts
LAW-16.statement: Holons MUST be closed under composition: a holon-of-holons interacts with peers and supervisors using the same primitive boundary channels and message shapes as a leaf holon. Cross-boundary communication MUST be coarse-grained (commitments, receipts, summaries, selectors), and any zoom-in to raw evidence MUST occur by content hash under explicitly delegated capability. New ad-hoc cross-boundary primitives are forbidden without a versioned interface contract and an explicit governance decision.

LAW-17.name: Verifier Independence
LAW-17.statement: High-risk authoritative promotion requires verifier diversity: at least two non-correlated verifier families must agree, and no single evaluator family may be a sole terminal authority for Tier2+ decisions.

verifier.acceptance_predicate: risk_tier in {T2,T3} => distinct_verifier_families >= 2 && correlation_risk <= policy.max_correlation && no_single_family_override

LAW-18.name: Revocation Latency and Propagation
LAW-18.statement: Revocation of authority (capabilities, keys, policy grants) must propagate with bounded latency across the declared trust surface; stale authority use after revocation SLO is a stop-the-line defect.

verifier.acceptance_predicate: revocation_event => coverage_complete_within_slo && stale_authority_accept_rate == 0 for required tiers

LAW-19.name: Uncertainty-Qualified Promotion
LAW-19.statement: Authoritative promotion decisions must carry explicit uncertainty class, confidence provenance, and residual-risk annotation; binary pass/fail is invalid when uncertainty is irreducible above policy limits.

LAW-20.name: Deterministic Re-verification Path
LAW-20.statement: High-impact gate decisions must expose a machine re-verification path that is deterministic within a declared determinism envelope (exact replay for deterministic verifiers, bounded-divergence replay for stochastic verifiers per LAW-04), with reproducible evidence package, independent verifier-family rerun, and receipt-bound outcome publication. Stochastic verifiers MUST declare their determinism class and acceptable divergence bound; re-verification passes iff divergence <= declared bound.

PRIN-001.name: Landauer’s Principle
PRIN-001.title: Erasure costs energy, so “free compute” is fake
PRIN-001.signal_statement: Treat **token budgets**, **tool budgets**, and **artifact bytes** not as "product limits" but as **thermodynamic proxies**: every extra tool call and every extra token is irrecoverable physical work somewhere. APM2 encodes this via **Context Discipline**: strict budgets (`apm2_core::budget`) and compiled ContextPacks prevent wasteful discovery. The missing feedback loop is cost-of-context-discovery telemetry: agents should track marginal context acquisition cost and feed it back into budget policy as a loss function, closing the loop between expenditure and information gain.

PRIN-005.name: Communication‑avoiding Algorithms
PRIN-005.title: Minimize bytes moved per unit of progress
PRIN-005.signal_statement: APM2 enforces **Context Discipline** to minimize communication: do not discover what can be compiled. Use **CAS + hashes** to pass references, not values. Tool protocol passes prompt hashes and artifact hashes rather than raw bodies. Extend this to **authority**: minimize *capability movement*—delegation should be rare, attenuated, and auditable.

PRIN-047.name: Event Sourcing
PRIN-047.title: Model system as sequence of decisions, not hidden state mutation
PRIN-047.signal_statement: this is literally APM2’s kernel: ledger events + deterministic reducers. Operationally: “the truth” is the event stream + CAS. Everything else is a projection. Scale does not change this semantic split: one box and global federation both treat projections as disposable caches over authoritative facts.

PRIN-049.name: Consensus For Control, Convergence For Data
PRIN-049.title: Minimize global serialization
PRIN-049.signal_statement: Reserve BFT consensus for shared-authority control-plane facts (membership, policy roots). Treat data-plane replication as convergent (CRDTs/anti-entropy) per **TRUTH-AX-07**. Global consensus on every event is a liveness hazard and contradicts the Unified Theory (Consensus is Expensive).

PRIN-053.name: Backpressure
PRIN-053.title: The only honest overload strategy
PRIN-053.signal_statement: APM2 already implements backpressure in resource governance for pulse subscriptions and in budgets for sessions. Push it everywhere: tool execution pools, replication streams, CI import, gate evaluation. Also: treat “cannot accept work” as a normal outcome, not an error. This is scale invariant: local worker pools and inter-cell planes use the same admission semantics: budget-aware, deny-and-receipt on exhaustion, never silent drop.

PRIN-090.name: Typed Tool Schemas + Structured Outputs
PRIN-090.title: Validate and parse, don’t “interpret” prose
PRIN-090.signal_statement: protobuf + validation is exactly right. The next step is ensuring every tool response is also structured and content-addressed, so downstream reasoning is about hashes and receipts, not uncontrolled text.

PRIN-092.name: Evidence-carrying Actions
PRIN-092.title: Every merge/deploy requires machine-checkable receipts
PRIN-092.signal_statement: AAT bundles, merge receipts, CI integrity receipts—these are not “docs,” they are the core security boundary. Anything not bound to evidence is not real. This predicate is unchanged by scale: local PR merges and federated promotions both require the same receipt/evidence/digest validity, with only proof economics and batching changing.

PRIN-094.name: Risk Classes + Autonomy Levels
PRIN-094.title: Gate authority by evidence and risk
PRIN-094.signal_statement: APM2 already encodes risk tiers in factory logic; make it universal with explicit four-tier Unified Theory semantics (T0..T3) and lossless mapping to daemon tiers (Tier0..Tier4): suggest → patch → merge → deploy are different effect classes requiring escalating receipts and isolation. The same risk vocabulary applies on one host and at federated scale; only evidence economics and verification batch sizes change, not the contract shape or gate semantics.

PRIN-100.name: Ashby’s Law Of Requisite Variety
PRIN-100.title: Only variety can destroy variety
PRIN-100.signal_statement: Holons must match the variety of their environment (inputs) with sufficient internal state or control options. However, **HB-05** inverts this: we constrain the *interface* variety via schemas so the internal controller doesn’t need infinite variety. **Context Discipline** acts as a variety filter, reducing the state space the agent must handle.

PRIN-101.name: Goodhart’s Law
PRIN-101.title: When a measure becomes a target, it ceases to be a good measure
PRIN-101.signal_statement: If you grade agents solely on "tickets closed", they will close invalid tickets. **MECH-MONITOR-ISOLATION** and **MECH-EVALUATOR-AUDIT** exist to prevent this. Metrics used for reward/training must be structurally separated from metrics used for oversight/audit (Law 8).

PRIN-105.name: Deterministic Re-verification and Reversal
PRIN-105.title: Correctness requires auditable re-check and bounded reversal paths
PRIN-105.signal_statement: Theory thread: closed-loop governance is incomplete without re-verification loops. A knowledge system is stronger when disagreement is resolved by independent machine reruns that can repair upstream assumptions.

PRIN-106.name: Epistemic Hygiene and Uncertainty Calibration
PRIN-106.title: Belief quality depends on calibration, provenance, and contradiction handling
PRIN-106.signal_statement: Theory thread: reasoning quality is a control problem over beliefs, not outputs. A robust theory stack preserves uncertainty metadata and differentiates unknown, conflicting, and falsified states.

PRIN-107.name: Ontology Governance and Semantic Drift
PRIN-107.title: Shared meaning requires explicit concept evolution rules
PRIN-107.signal_statement: Theory thread: semantics must be governed as infrastructure. Concept drift, alias sprawl, and implicit renaming are epistemic failure modes that degrade model signal-to-noise over time. This is scale invariant: semantic drift destroys correctness in a single repository and in a 100B-agent federation alike.

PRIN-108.name: Epochal Schema Evolution
PRIN-108.title: Forward evolution with explicit discontinuities
PRIN-108.signal_statement: Theory thread: evolution speed comes from explicit epoch cuts, typed migration receipts, and clear validity windows. Backward compatibility can be offered selectively, but the default is forward movement with auditable transition semantics.

PRIN-111.name: Civilizational Agent Ecology
PRIN-111.title: Design with one invariant architecture from small cells to 100B-agent holarchies
PRIN-111.signal_statement: Theory thread: treat single-host 10-20 agent deployments as small cells of the same holonic system. Do not fork semantics by scale; vary placement, capacity, and verifier economics while keeping authority, evidence, and composition primitives identical.

PRIN-112.name: Forward-Only Evolution
PRIN-112.title: Prefer explicit epoch cuts over perpetual compatibility drag
PRIN-112.signal_statement: Theory thread: deliberate discontinuity can raise signal-to-noise when transition boundaries are explicit, signed, and testable. The objective is not compatibility theater; it is semantic clarity across time.

PRIN-121.name: Verifier Diversity and Independence
PRIN-121.title: High-stakes confidence requires non-correlated verifiers
PRIN-121.signal_statement: APM2 gates should not collapse into single-evaluator authority. Tier2+ decisions require explicit verifier-family metadata, independence checks, and disagreement escalation to reduce common-mode failure. This is cross-scale: local deployments can realize independence via separate rerun stacks/toolchains, while federated deployments add cell-level family diversity and cross-cell disagreement routing.

PRIN-122.name: Drift Taxonomy and Detection
PRIN-122.title: Separate covariate, prior, concept, and evaluator drift
PRIN-122.signal_statement: APM2 freshness and stability controls should label drift class explicitly in receipts and defects. Incorrect drift attribution causes unstable policy updates and wasted remediation effort.

PRIN-123.name: Summary Rate-Distortion Contracts
PRIN-123.title: Compression is valid only with explicit loss bounds
PRIN-123.signal_statement: Summaries should be treated as budgeted information products. For Tier2+, summary-only decisions are valid only when distortion bounds and selector coverage satisfy the governing gate policy.

PRIN-124.name: Revocation-Wins Delegated Authority
PRIN-124.title: Delegation must converge toward least authority under partitions
PRIN-124.signal_statement: Capability delegation across holonic boundaries should use revocation-wins semantics, explicit propagation receipts, and tiered revocation SLOs so containment survives partitions and lagging replicas. Same principle at every scale: branch/work leases on one host and cross-cell capability grants both fail closed on stale authority.

record_schema.description: DefectRecord is an evidence-backed counterexample linked to intent/contracts and pipeline artifacts. Primary uses: dedupe, clustering, automated remediation, governance.

violation_code.description: Specific Law/Mechanism violation code if applicable.

inefficiency.description: Optional inefficiency annotations; defects MAY be classified as pure inefficiency.

statement.description: Counterexample form: expected predicate/contract vs observed behavior; include minimal context needed for interpretation; avoid narrative.

analysis.description: Optional; added by classifier agents post-intake.

fingerprint.description: Deterministic hash over normalized fields for dedupe/clustering. Minimum inputs: defect_domain + surface + normalized title + key links + repro[0].cmd.

items: Evidence integrity: content addressing, retention, replay.
Fail-closed gates: no merge/promotion without required receipts.
Capability least privilege and SoD enforcement.
Deterministic structured outputs for automation surfaces.

core_theory_statements.defect_as_counterexample: A defect is an evidence-backed counterexample that falsifies an intent predicate or a contract under a verifier. A defect is not limited to functional incorrectness; any avoidable work, avoidable risk, avoidable ambiguity, or avoidable non-determinism is a defect. A defect record MUST be replayable in principle; if full replay is impossible, the defect record MUST declare a residual-evidence specification documenting the gap, the circumstances that prevent replay, and sufficient context for an independent agent to reproduce or bound the failure.
core_theory_statements.intent_contract_verifier_evidence: Intent is a predicate over system state and/or traces. Contracts are normative interface constraints (CLI output, daemon API semantics, schema shape, policy rules). Verifiers are procedures that produce Pass or Fail(counterexample). Evidence is the replayable artifact set bound to a verifier outcome. An autonomous SDLC is a refinement compiler that maps intent predicates through contracts and verifiers into evidence-backed authoritative transitions; each refinement step narrows the solution space and must itself be receipted.
core_theory_statements.closure_criteria: A defect is closed only when: - a verifier exists that fails on the original counterexample, - the verifier passes on the fixed state, - evidence receipts are captured and referenced, - the relevant contract/intent references are updated when applicable. “Works on my machine” is a defect. Closure is evidence-backed.

usage_notes: Trace matrix guides triage, clustering, and countermeasure selection.
Mappings are defaults and may be extended per-incident with evidence-backed machine re-verification.

AX-01.name: Stochastic Transducer
AX-01.statement: LLMs are conditional distributions p(y|x), not proof systems. Correctness requires external verification.

AX-02.name: Bounded Context Channel
AX-02.statement: Context window W is a hard bandwidth limit; state must be compressed (s) such that |s| <= W via Context Discipline.

AX-05.name: Contract-Cognition Interface
AX-05.statement: Contracts (predicates P(x)) provide stability for unstable stochastic cognition.

AX-06.name: Claims-Evidence Disjunction
AX-06.statement: Claims are untrusted until bound to reproducible cryptographic evidence.

AX-07.name: Monotonic Growth
AX-07.statement: Prefer monotone, commutative updates over destructive edits to reduce coordination complexity.

AX-10.name: Selective Permeability
AX-10.statement: Information and authority flow must be constrained via capabilities (OCAP) and Variety Control.

AX-15.name: Ambient Authority Elimination
AX-15.statement: Any implicit privilege is a vulnerability; all authority must be externalized into unforgeable objects.

AX-21.name: Scale-Invariant Interface Composition
AX-21.statement: A holarchic system scales only if it is closed under composition: a holon-of-holons must be addressable and governable through the same boundary primitives as a single holon.

AX-25.name: Deterministic Re-verification
AX-25.statement: Correctness in high-impact systems requires deterministic re-verification and bounded-reversal channels with evidence-addressable dispute paths.

AX-27.name: Externality Closure
AX-27.statement: Optimization quality depends on accounting for externalized energy, storage, operator, and social costs.

MOD-EVENT.name: Event Sourcing
MOD-EVENT.statement: State is a projection (reduction) of an append-only sequence or partial order of events.

MOD-EVIDENCE.name: Cryptographic Commitment
MOD-EVIDENCE.statement: Evidence is bound to claims via cryptographic commitment: content-addressed hashing, digital signatures, and tamper-evident chaining ensure that evidence integrity is independently verifiable.

MOD-COMPAT.name: Schema Evolution
MOD-COMPAT.statement: Schema changes are transformations in a type system; compatibility is a constraint on reader/writer interaction.

MOD-CAP.name: Object Capability (OCAP)
MOD-CAP.statement: Authority = Possession of unforgeable object reference.

MOD-CONV.name: Convergent Replication
MOD-CONV.statement: Consistency via monotone updates and merge operators (CRDT). Distinguish Control (BFT) vs Data (Convergence).

MOD-SUMMARY.name: Multi-Scale Artifacts
MOD-SUMMARY.statement: Summaries are lossy compressions of evidence with explicit selector coverage, loss profiles, and zoom-in paths to source artifacts via content-addressed references.

STRAT-VERIFY.name: External Anchoring
STRAT-VERIFY.rule: Verify stochastic LLM outputs via deterministic tools (tests, linters, schemas).

STRAT-VERIFIABLE-REFS.name: Verifiable References
STRAT-VERIFIABLE-REFS.rule: Inject content-hashes and stable IDs into context; expand details only on demand.

STRAT-CANONICAL.name: Canonical Encoding
STRAT-CANONICAL.rule: Use JCS/Canonical formats to ensure stable content addressing and avoid spurious diffs.

STRAT-CONTRACT-FIRST.name: Contract-First Design
STRAT-CONTRACT-FIRST.rule: Prioritize structural contracts to reduce ambiguity in the finite context channel.

STRAT-OCAP-FIRST.name: Capability Default
STRAT-OCAP-FIRST.rule: Default to safe impossibility by withholding capabilities from agents unless explicitly required.

STRAT-LEAST-AUTHORITY.name: Confinement
STRAT-LEAST-AUTHORITY.rule: Minimize privilege surface using OCAP to limit impact of harmful agent actions.

STRAT-GATED-AUTONOMY.name: Bounded Failure
STRAT-GATED-AUTONOMY.rule: Define task success as either Predicate(result) == True OR Bound(FailureEvidence).

STRAT-IDEMPOTENCY.name: Reliable Execution
STRAT-IDEMPOTENCY.rule: Ensure all agent-facing primitives are idempotent to survive distributed reordering.

STRAT-CROSS-SCALE-INVARIANCE.name: Cross-Scale Invariance
STRAT-CROSS-SCALE-INVARIANCE.rule: Keep authority, evidence, and composition primitives identical across scales; tune only budgets, topology, and verifier economics.

exclusions.reason: Excluded to keep theory kernel-first and remove orchestration/runtime implementation detail.

terminology_compact.intent: Canonical terminology kernel replacing legacy glossary skill references.

holon.definition: Autonomous boundary-bearing actor: state + authority + interfaces under explicit contracts.

boundary_channel.definition: Typed, canonicalized ingress/egress surface where all cross-holon interaction must occur; enforcement point for dual-axis containment.

channel_class.definition: Declared boundary communication class constraining admissible payload shape, semantics, and replay behavior.

context_pack.definition: Versioned, budgeted working set for a task; scoped context only, no ambient read authority.

context_pack_manifest.definition: Receipted manifest declaring the bounded, content-addressed artifact allowlist for a ContextPack.

lease.definition: Time-bounded authority grant with explicit termination and renewal semantics.

budget.definition: Quantified bound on search/work expenditure enforced by policy; exhaustion triggers stop, decompose, or escalate.

typed_budget_vector.definition: Machine-checkable realization of `budget`; unitful tuple (tokens, tool_calls, wall_ms, ...) enforcing bounded search and stop semantics.

ocap.definition: Unforgeable capability token representing attenuated authority; no ambient privilege.

identity_proof.definition: Auditable identity evidence binding actor lineage and signing authority to accountability records.

ledger.definition: Append-only fact substrate with explicit merge semantics; authoritative history is monotone.

event_record.definition: Atomic append-only ledger fact entry carrying payload commitment, ordering anchor, and integrity linkage.

anti_entropy_protocol.definition: Declared reconciliation procedure for forked distributed views using merge semantics and receipted convergence cycles.

receipt.definition: Tamper-evident evidence record proving a check, actuation, or decision outcome.

evidence.definition: Reproducible, addressable artifacts that can independently validate a claim or gate outcome.

gate.definition: Policy-indexed closure checkpoint that maps evidence to pass/pending/fail under fail-dominant semantics.

risk_tier.definition: Policy-declared impact tier used to select gate strength, evidence depth, and acceptable residual uncertainty.

terminal_verifier.definition: Machine-checkable predicate implementation that decides gate acceptance from bound evidence.

view_commitment.definition: Cryptographic commitment to a bounded view of the substrate, anchored to a ledger state.

merge_receipt.definition: Evidence that reconciliation applied declared join/conflict rules and recorded resulting state.

episode.definition: Bounded execution slice with declared intent, inputs, outputs, and receipt-linked transitions.

daemon.definition: Long-lived coordinating process that enforces policy, lifecycle, and evidence routing for local agents/tools.

oracle.definition: External signal ingress under explicit trust policy, freshness bounds, and evidence qualification. Oracle facts enter the substrate L only via dedicated oracle_gate with explicit trust_policy, freshness_bound, and evidence_qualification; oracle facts are second-class until promoted by a containment-tier gate.

world_effect.definition: Any operation that produces observable state change outside the holon's private kernel state K_h, including but not limited to: file I/O, network I/O, process signals, shared memory mutations, persistent storage writes, and cross-boundary message sends. All world effects MUST be receipted per LAW-11.

tcb.definition: Trusted Computing Base: the minimal set of components whose correct operation is necessary for system security properties to hold. Includes: kernel runtime, capability enforcement engine, ledger integrity verifier, cryptographic primitives, and genesis policy. TCB growth MUST be bounded and auditable; unbounded TCB is a STOP_THE_LINE defect (violation code TCB_UNBOUNDED).
